newsitem.title: TURKEY: Jordan concerned over Turkey's Iraq operation.
newsitem.headline: Jordan concerned over Turkey's Iraq operation.

text.p: Jordan's Crown Prince Hassan on Thursday expressed concern about the four-week-old Turkish military operation against Kurdish rebels in northern Iraq, Turkey's state-run Anatolian news agency said.

"I came here to represent Jordan's King Hussein and to express his views. Jordan is concerned about the operation continuing in northern Iraq," Anatolian quoted the crown prince as telling reporters at Ankara airport at the start of a one-day visit to Turkey.
He was later due to meet President Suleyman Demirel, Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan and General Cevik Bir, second-in-command of the armed forces,
More than 10,000 Turkish troops entered northern Iraq on May 14 to pursue guerrillas from the Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK), who use the region to launch attacks on southeast Turkey.
The operation has drawn condemnation from the Arab League secretariat and a demand that Turkish forces withdraw at once. Jordan itself made a similar call a fortnight ago.
"We know the operation is being carried out because of terrorism. But we cannot accept any change that might occur in the map of the region," the crown prince said.
The PKK has fought for self rule in southeast Turkey for the last 13 years in a conflict with the military that has claimed more than 24,000 lives.
